t: Psalm 73
BOOK THREE: Psalms 73—89
The Tragedy of the Wicked, and the Blessedness of Trust in God
A Psalm of Asaph.
Truly*pn God is*i good to Israel, To*ld such as are pure in heart.
But*ld as for me, my feet had almost stumbled; My*ld steps had nearly slipped.
For*ld I was*i envious of the boastful, When*ld I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
For*ln there*i are*i no pangs in their death, But*ld their strength is*i firm.
They*ld are*i not in trouble as*i other*i men, Nor*ld are they plagued like other*i men.
Therefore*ld pride serves as their necklace; Violence*ld covers them like*i a garment.
Their*ld eyes bulge with abundance; They*ld have more than heart could wish.
They*ld scoff and speak wickedly concerning*i oppression; They*ld speak loftily.
They*ld set their mouth against the heavens, And*ld their tongue walks through the earth.
Therefore*ln his people return here, And*ld waters of a full cup*i are drained by them.
And*ld they say, “How does God know? And*ld is there knowledge in the Most High?”
Behold,*ld these are*i the ungodly, Who*ld are always at ease; They*ld increase in*i riches.
Surely*ld I have cleansed my heart in*i vain, And*ld washed my hands in innocence.
For*ld all day long I have been plagued, And*ld chastened every morning.
If*ln I had said, “I will speak thus,” Behold,*ld I would have been untrue to the generation of Your children.
When*ld I thought how*i to understand this, It*ld was*i too painful for me—
Until*ld I went into the sanctuary of God; Then*ild I understood their end.
Surely*ln You set them in slippery places; You*ld cast them down to destruction.
Oh,*ld how they are brought*i to desolation, as in a moment! They*ld are utterly consumed with terrors.
As*ld a dream when one*i awakes, So,*ild Lord, when You awake, You*ld shall despise their image.
Thus*ln my heart was grieved, And*ld I was vexed in my mind.
I*ld was*i so foolish and ignorant; I*ld was like*i a beast before You.
Nevertheless*ld I am*i continually with You; You*ld hold me*i by my right hand.
You*ld will guide me with Your counsel, And*ld afterward receive me to*i glory.
Whom*ln have I in heaven but*i You?*i And*ld there*i is*i none upon earth that*i I desire besides You.
My*ld flesh and my heart fail; But*ild God is*i the strength of my heart and my portion forever.
For*ln indeed, those who are far from You shall perish; You*ld have destroyed all those who desert You for harlotry.
But*ld it*i is*i good for me to draw near to God; I*ld have put my trust in the Lord God,*s That*ld I may declare all Your works.
